content.prompt: Which of the following is true of the conservation of momentum and kinetic energy?

choices.label: Momentum is conserved only in elastic collisions.
Momentum is conserved only in inelastic collisions.
Kinetic energy is conserved only in elastic collisions.
Kinetic energy is conserved only in inelastic collisions.
Both require the same conditions in order to be conserved.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
